programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Hays and Bigfoot's hands are forced when the Empresario enlists them to protect the town from a Comanche attack. Elsewhere, Emily arouses Santa Anna's suspicions.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt Wright's challenge is to capture a dangerous crocodile that has been creeping worryingly close to humans and cattle, but relocating the 16ft killer by helicopter will not be an easy task.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate mysterious beings with big heads and eyes, whose images were found carved into rocks. Known as the 'greys', they are rumoured to be alien life forms.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts analyse whether natural causes were responsible for the volcanoes, earthquakes and floods of ancient times - and the possibility that it was down to aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: With over 40,000 wristbands to sell, stored in 126 boxes, Les decides to sell them one by one, starting at $2 apiece. Seth and Ashley remain sceptical of the idea.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley make a series of bets to see if they or Les can purchase any item that comes into the store that they would otherwise dismiss as 'junk'.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A customer pays the team $10,000 to restore a 1950s soda fountain - and expects to get his money's worth. The guys also try to restore a vintage phone box.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is asked to make a barber's chair look like a sports car, while Tyler and Ron deal with a disagreement by playing pranks on each other.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a classic guitar for Brettly's birthday, and a rare hunting scooter arrives in the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team is hired to restore a very important sign, and Pawn Stars' Rick Harrison brings in a unique vending machine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum goes with his gut instead of bringing in an expert when buying a risky item. Also, Rick checks out a 1965 service medal from Panama Canal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team comes face to face with a life-size Creature from the Black Lagoon, and Rick gets the inside scoop with a handwritten love letter from Judy Garland to Frank Sinatra.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1 which suggest that cover-ups and conspiracy theories have concealed the secrets for decades. This instalment investigates suggestions that US President Ronald Reagan's personal encounters with UFOs may have been the driving force behind his 'Star Wars' Strategic Defence Initiative.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the work of Nasa and secret government files relating to extraterrestrial activity, looking for proof of alien contact in the recent or distant past.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: After test-driving the infamous OJ Simpson Bronco, Rick Harrison must decide whether to purchase this million-dollar item. Plus, a rare silverware set and a 1978 Star Wars comic come under consideration.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave returns to the fray, having run out of stock after missing several auctions. Barry comes up with a new strategy, and Darrell gets lost on his way to a sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: For the first time, the bladesmiths begin on a farm where they harvest steel from farming tools, then craft the decorated and deadly Schiavona sword.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1930s Gottlieb grip tester arrives at the shop, and Rick Harrison gets hung up on a limited edition piece of abstract art by Hollywood actor Anthony Quinn.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out some vintage Marvel comics, inspiring Chumlee to dig through his own collection to see if he has anything valuable.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate case files that suggest a shadow government exists and operates beyond public and congressional scrutiny to protect and conceal information about UFOs. The documentary exposes the extreme measures taken to protect these secrets from being revealed, and examines the origins of the alleged organisation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the similarities between huge pyramids across the world, and hypothesise on whether extraterrestrials could have influenced their construction and design.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's anger over Seth and Ashley's sibling rivalry boils over to the point that he gives them an ultimatum to calm down or be sacked - but they carry on bickering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Bold buyers Brandi, Jarrod, Barry and Dave smoke out the competition with their sharp eyes in California. But who will buy trash and who will find treasure?.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave risks his money on buying a locker that has not been opened in 20 years, while Barry gets hold of a unique racing car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Some of the priciest items in the pawn shop's history, including a $70,000 Panama Pacific gold coin from 1915.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the Pawn Stars' archive, including a Civil War veteran's rifle and a campaign ribbon from Lincoln's first election in 1860

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths are tasked with forging a signature blade from a bicycle. Two are later tasked to re-create an ancient, mysterious weapon called wind and fire wheels.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge and using his remarkable skills honed over a decade, Alec Steele re-creates an M9 Bayonet.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge and using his remarkable skills honed over a decade, Alec Steele crafts a pirate cutlass.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave returns to the fray, having run out of stock after missing several auctions. Barry comes up with a new strategy, and Darrell gets lost on his way to a sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jack Whitehall, Katherine Ryan, Rich Hall
programme.desc: An evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Jack Whitehall is the man in charge, treating the audience to his own brand of humour, before introducing routines by Canadian comedienne Katherine Ryan and American jokester Rich Hall.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Susan Calman, Hal Cruttenden and Romesh Ranganathan on an edition of the comedy quiz first aired in July 2014. The panellists give their take on that week's major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Emma Barnett and stand-up Tom Allen joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian takes a job in a hair and beauty salon, quickly believing himself ready to work on real customers as he tries an all-over tan and perfects his own unique version of the bob.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan sets out on another international odyssey to meet members of his extended family. This time, he meet relatives who left Sri Lanka and settled in the USA, and by visiting them in Florida, Romesh hopes to get a taste of what his life could have been like if his parents had opted to migrate to the US instead of the UK. However, for this trip, his mother Shanthi is tagging along, as she fulfils her dream of visiting her relatives across the Atlantic. Marshalled by his cousin Pratheep, who has arranged a week of all-American entertainment, Romesh and his mother sample life stateside, but when Romesh ditches Shanthi to attend a beer-chugging Frat initiation, things begin to turn sour between the pair.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian's sense of humour is put to the test when he is sent to the Brecon Beacons to take part in one of the British Army's most gruelling training exercises.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: An officer is assaulted by a man he is trying to take into custody for beating his partner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz try to acquire Star Wars goodies in California.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees bidders in Preston, where Heavy D's gamble might just leave him with the hump, and viewers see if Jesse has what it takes to win big in the UK.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders in Lewes, East Sussex, where a vehicle sends bids sky high, John has spotted treasure, and Scotty and Dan play dirty.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys discover a rare 1930s coupe at Buckey's one-man ranch and the numbers are not in Mike's favour when Frank shows off his beautiful mind.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: An Evel Knievel super-fan reveals some of the legendary daredevil's most personal items.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi embarks on a complete redesign of Cheshire Constabulary's fleet of outdated forensic vans and a crime car comes in with a faulty wailer - but the fault remains elusive.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell, who invites cameras into his workshop as he builds customised cars from junk.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three hosts are each given a budget of Â£5,000 to find a car that can hold its own on a racetrack and handle everyday tasks, before testing their purchases in Germany. James May puts two Porsches through their paces on the Top Gear test circuit, and former Downing Street communications director Alastair Campbell tries out the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters search for the world's best four-seat supercar, pitting the Aston Martin Rapide against the Porsche Panamera Turbo and Maserati Quattroporte in a series of unusual challenges in the south of England. Harry Potter star Rupert Grint and ex-Formula One driver Rubens Barrichello each do a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car and Richard Hammond puts the Chevrolet Camaro SS and Mercedes E63 AMG through their paces on the test track.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Jimmy Carr, Gyles Brandreth and Sally Phillips, who answer questions on the subject of piecemeal, with points awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments. Among the celebrity guests are Kevin Bishop, Warwick Davis, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Sara Cox and Brian Blessed.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe and Johnny Vegas and former MP Ed Balls join regular panellist Alan Davies. to answer questions about subjects associated with various parts.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Gary Delaney, Tiffany Stevenson and Romesh Ranganathan for the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories from July 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A labyrinth of tunnels underneath a tiny French village which contains mysteries from several historical eras, and a Welsh slate mine that has been given a new lease of life.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: Racegoers head to two major meetings at Newbury Racecourse, with the company sending staff to a usually unmanned station to help keep things running smoothly. Paddington controller Dave Turner ensures that the correct train arrives at the intended platform at the right time, and the emergency services are called into action at the Penzance depot.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A strange-looking town with a supernatural atmosphere, a collection of imposing buildings in southern Australia, and the remains of curious-looking basins emerging from the waves.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Alan Price and Georgie Fame guest on the vintage comedy show, starring Messrs Barker and Corbett.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Drama about military police and their families faced with political and personal conflicts in a 1960s British colony on the Red Sea coast. An officer and his wife arrive in Aden, where he is to replace a much-loved captain. He soon has to adjust to life on the frontline, along with resentment among the men that he was appointed instead of the already-present Lt Ed Laithwaite. Honor is taken under the wing of Laithwaite's wife, Alison, who had been having an affair with Captain Page. Starring Jessie Buckley and Jeremy Neumark Jones.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Angel and Tess are on their honeymoon when he decides it is time for them to admit their former transgressions, but while she forgives his, he is appalled by what his new wife tells him and heads off to Brazil to set up a farm there by himself. She then finds a job on a bleak farm run by Groby and bumps into Alec, who claims he is a changed man and proposes marriage. Gemma Arterton stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the London airport returns for a fifth season. Inside the terminal, seasoned pro Demi dishes out deals for delayed passengers, while outside on the airfield, Ian is on the runway as it goes into lockdown with a full armed police presence. For the first time this series, viewers will also see the work of the Border Force's canine drugs detection team - Rachel and her dog Cole, who in his career has intercepted more than Â£1million worth of class-A contraband. Narrated by Julie Walters.

programme.title: Holiday Horrors: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary series looking at what can go wrong on holiday, including a ski trip that became a fight for survival, a horrific case of sunburn, and what happened when a wildfire spread across the holiday hotspot of Javea in Spain. Presented by Jamie Theakston.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Cold Feet and Downton Abbey star Robert Bathurst talks about returning to the London stage and how he feels about being told he looks just like Piers Morgan.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a team of five friends who go fishing together answers questions about top 10 lists then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Mick, Roberta, Danny and Katie pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vanessa is left desperate, Charity is disheartened, and Dawn hides her worries.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ray tells Abi he's reported her to the police for stealing his car and torching it. Knowing the house to be empty, James takes Danny back to No 3 and leads him up the stairs. And Gemma's horrified to realise the Freshco photoshoot clashes with Aled's hearing appointment.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.desc: The financial journalist and Angellica Bell offer advice to viewers about consumer rights when buying goods in store and online, and look at what the best mortgage rates are for people who are navigating the property market?.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ali calls at Maria's flat and begs her to give their relationship a chance, convinced she feels the same way about him. Gemma tells Chesney that Frescho will have to reschedule the photoshoot as Aled's doctor's appointment is far more important, and it looks like Ed may discover Danny and James's relationship.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam and Karen's future is thrown into jeopardy by an unexpected offer, and David is in turmoil over his growing feelings for Robyn. While Jenny braces herself for her first mammogram after her treatment for cancer, Pete helps their son Adam realise his dream. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in the concluding instalment of the ninth season of Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Frances Barber and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The BRITs at 40
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall narrates a look back at the history of the awards ceremony, featuring archive footage of some of the most memorable moments, from Oasis and Blur's rivalry to Stormzy's attack on the government, and classic performances by Adele, Rihanna and Drake. The programme also recalls less successful moments, from the infamous 1989 ceremony hosted by Mick Fleetwood and Sam Fox, and Madonna struggles with her cape. Featuring interviews with stars including Robbie Williams, Mel B, Mick Fleetwood, Little Mix, Sam Smith, Ellie Goulding, Sharon Osbourne, Bros, Dua Lipa, Rick Astley and Tom Jones.

programme.title: 90s vs 00s: The Love Songs
programme.desc: It's the ultimate battle of the decades! We're putting the love songs from the 90s up against the love songs of the 00s to see who did it best.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team investigates a secret U-Boat docking station that could have aided Hitler's escape from Europe, and discover a sunken sub near Caleta de Loros.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: A deadly caiman targets Mehgan, and a potentially crippling accident leads to a shocking find - a coded message from the past that may bring the prospectors closer to gold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini investigates a lead on a 1956 Citroen 2CV in North Carolina, as he suspects it could be one of the first of its kind to be imported into the US.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini recommisions his 1934 Lincoln KB convertible for the Keels & Wheels concours in Texas.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Jr cracks out the chrome for the chopper and it's looking good. And Mikey wants to prove a point on the racetrack but can he keep up with the pace guy?.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Emmett believes his 1964 Barracuda is all original, but Dan finds out that the car has a past that nobody expected. Plus, Dan fixes a 1953 Studebaker Commande.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. The duo head to Staffordshire on the trail of a Ford Capri. They find a beauty, but it's got tatty bodywork and needs a new interior.

programme.title: Snooker: Welsh Open
programme.desc: Action from the final in Cardiff.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former model Meghan comes all the way from St Louis to find the perfect dress for her wedding to a baseball player.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride comes to the shop from Dubai in search of her dream dress, and another customer is determined that her princess-style gown should be just right.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown visits Beijing and treats his first hamster, is stunned to have to tend to some pet snails, and has an unforgettable encounter with giant pandas.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Debbie is horrified to discover a herd of emaciated horses and Maverick rescues a dog with a serious leg wound. Plus, the team carries out a rescue of livestock during a heat wave.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Maverick Wagner races to save an injured kitten that has fallen down a drain during storm season, while investigators hurry to rescue a donkey that is buried up to its neck in mud.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of famous faces for items to transform and sell to raise money for charity, beginning by visiting Sinitta and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The tools of detection are at the forefront of technology. This programme reveals the groundbreaking techniques being employed to catch deadly killers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of Tim Carney, who vanished on his way to church for morning prayers. The mystery deepened when his car was later retrieved from the airport and his bank account found to have been almost emptied.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Bobby and Sherilyn Jamison, who vanished along with their six-year-old daughter Madison in Oklahoma in October 2009. Detectives eventually uncovered a series of disconnected leads pointing to drugs, family dysfunction, and even supernatural beliefs.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A lesbian couple want very different looks for their wedding, while a wedding planner is determined that her bride has a perfect fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A transgender bride wants a country music-inspired dress, a customer wants a gown she can also run a marathon in, and a father has a big surprise.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Want My Daughter to Look Like a Sexpot
programme.desc: Randy arranges a surprise for his mother on her 93rd birthday, and a pregnant bride needs a dress that she can grow into.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: We're Going to Say 'I Do' Underwater!
programme.desc: A bride wants a gown for an underwater ceremony, and an ambitious businesswoman wants a colourful dress.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Architectural salvage expert Drew Pritchard visits a stately home in Barnstaple, where he tries to charm Lady Arran. Then, he finds plenty of neon treats in Bournemouth.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of famous faces for items to transform and sell to raise money for charity, beginning by visiting Sinitta and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the stories of Lupe and Ashley. Although half her former size, Lupe struggled to lose enough weight to qualify for skin surgery. Meanwhile, Ashley's emotional state derailed her weight loss journey and she was rocked by sudden paralysis.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The wives put together a collection of photos and videos to create a history of the family, revealing how each of the women came to marry Kody.

programme.title: Raising Tourette's
programme.desc: It's graduation day for Kristin and Kaden prepares for his cello performance. Meanwhile, Colton has the biggest surprise of his life and Charlee goes on stage.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents go after a former state trooper when a woman fails to return from her date with a handsome stranger.
